title: British man, 34, and woman, 33, drown off Portuguese beach
text:
Local police say they believe the pair were on holiday with a group of friends (Picture: Solarpix)

A British man and woman have drowned off a beach in Portugal after experiencing difficulties while swimming.

The tragedy happened at 2.30pm local time, as the man tried to help his friend, who clung on to a rock after he noticed that she was in trouble, local media reported.

The incident took place at a beach on Zambujeira do Mar in Portugal’s Alentejo region.

Local rushed to their aid and tried to revive the pair on the beach.

The tragedy happened around 2.30pm local time today (Picture: Solarpix)

A Portuguese Air Force helicopter airlifted the bodies from the beach to a nearby hospital (Picture: Solarpix)

The bodies of the unnamed pair were taken by a Portuguese air force helicopter to the nearby town of Beja.

Commander of the local maritime police force Rui Pedro Silva Felipe said: ‘I can confirm they are both British citizens.

‘The man was 34 and the woman was 33.

‘I cannot confirm 100 per cent but I believe they were in Portugal on holiday with a group of friends.’

He added that the sea at the time of the incident was ‘a little rough’ and that there was no lifeguard service after September 15 on the beach.
